class_notes:
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


ENGRD 124 is an academic communication skills course designed to prepare English language learners for success at Emory and beyond. In this class, students will develop their speaking, reading, listening, and vocabulary skills through engagement with authentic materials. In addition, they participate in a variety of practical activities, for instance a multimodal presentation, to refine their professional communication skills. Students further hone their knowledge of rhetorical concepts addressed in ENGRD 101 and elsewhere, including audience, purpose, tone, and argument. The texts and visual materials for this class focus on different facets of communication and language, as students learn how to navigate various genres, fields, and modes.
Contact Jane O'Connor at jcoconn@emory.edu for an enrollment permission number.
This one-credit-hour course meets on Tuesdays only.
course_description: An Academic communication skills course designed to prepare English language learners for success at Emory and throughout their academic careers. Focus on speaking, reading, listening, and vocabulary skills through engagement with authentic materials, such as lectures and presentations.
